sections.content: Main module of the library.
Key representing an implicit 'catch-all' navigation referenced in  [Navigation](@nav/api/MainModule.Navigation) .

code.declaration: CatchAllKey = '...'

sections.content:
Represents global Markdown views that can be referenced when using  [parseMd](@nav/api/MainModule.parseMd) .

By default, it is populated with  `code-snippet` , more information in  [CodeSnippetView](@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeSnippetView) .

The definition of a custom view is provided using a function that:
*  Takes as single argument the HTML element as declared in the markdown file.
The raw text content within the DOM element can be accessed using  `elem.textContent`  and attributes using
 `elem.getAttribute` .
*  Returns a virtual dom defining the corresponding implementation of the HTML element.
Static factory for markdown inlined views.

code.declaration: export class GlobalMarkdownViews

sections.content: Represents the router of the application.

The base path on which the router is defined.

If the application is served from  `https://my-domain/my-app/version`  it is  `/my-app/version` .

code.declaration: public readonly basePath: string

sections.content:
When using a dynamic definition of the routes (see  [Navigation](@nav/api/MainModule.Navigation) ),
it may be the case that the routes are not yet available when navigating to a page.
Attempt to re-navigate to the page is executed every  `retryNavPeriod`  second.

code.declaration: public readonly retryNavPeriod: number = 1000

sections.content: Initialize a router instance.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **params**: see corresponding documentation in the class's attributes
*  **basePath**: the base path
*  **navigation**: navigation object
*  **retryNavPeriod**: wehn to retry

Clients need to invoke this function when dynamic change on the current main HTML page have occurred after the
initial rendering. Other views dependening on it (*e.g.* the table of content) will refresh as well.

export class Router

sections.content:
Node definition when using implicit 'catch-all' sub-navigation resolver,
see  [Navigation](@nav/api/MainModule.Navigation) .
Defines attributes regarding the visual rendering of the node if the navigation view.
Gathers the resolved elements when navigating to a specific path.

Represents a lazy navigation resolver, used when the navigation is only known at runtime.

It is a function that takes the target path and router's instance as parameters, and returns
the instance of  [CatchAllNav](@nav/api/MainModule.CatchAllNav)  that explicits node attributes ( `name` ,  `id` ,  `children` , *etc.*).
Arguments defining the children part of a navigation node when using dynamic  [CatchAllNav](@nav/api/MainModule.CatchAllNav) .

Fully resolved navigation node when using  [CatchAllNav](@nav/api/MainModule.CatchAllNav) .
In practical usage, consumers of the library only needs to provide  [NavNodeInput](@nav/api/MainModule.NavNodeInput) .
Represents a node in the navigation.

code.declaration:
export type Navigation = NavigationCommon & {
    /**
     * Name of the node.
     */
    name: string

    /**
     * Decoration configuration for the node.
     */
    decoration?: Decoration

    /**
     * Dynamic 'catch-all' sub-navigation resolver, used when the navigation is only known at runtime.
     *
     * The sub-paths defined in it can also be made reaction (using {@link ReactiveLazyNavResolver})
     * if changes in organisation over time are expected.
     */
    [CatchAllKey]?: LazyNavResolver | ReactiveLazyNavResolver

    /**
     * Static sub-navigation resolver.
     */
    [key: `/${string}`]: Navigation
}

sections.content: The common part of a navigation node, whether it is static or dynamic.

code.declaration:
export type NavigationCommon = {
    /**
     * This function represents the view of the main content.
     *
     * @param router Router instance.
     * @returns A resolvable view
     */
    html: ({ router }) => Resolvable<AnyVirtualDOM>
    /**
     * This function represents the view of the table of content in the page.
     *
     * @param p arguments of the view generator:
     *   *  html : Content of the HTML page
     *   *  router : Router instance.
     * @returns A promise on the view
     */
    tableOfContent?: (p: {
        html: HTMLElement
        router: Router
    }) => Promise<AnyVirtualDOM>
}

sections.content: Options for parsing Markdown content.

Represents a reactive lazy navigation resolver, used when changes in a navigation node children are expected
(within  [Navigation](@nav/api/MainModule.Navigation) ).

code.declaration: export type ReactiveLazyNavResolver = Observable<LazyNavResolver>

sections.content:
Represents something resolvable.

Important:
    When an observable is provided, only its **first emission** is accounted.

code.declaration: export type Resolvable<T> = T | Promise<T> | Observable<T>

sections.content: Type definition for custom view generators.

code.declaration: export type viewGenerator = (e: HTMLElement) => AnyVirtualDOM

sections.content:
Parse a Markdown file specified with a URL.

Note that custom views provided using the attribute `views  comes in addition to those registered globally in
 [GlobalMarkdownViews](@nav/api/MainModule.GlobalMarkdownViews) .

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **args**: see  [ParsingArguments](@nav/api/MainModule.ParsingArguments)  for additional options.
*  **navigations**: Specify custom redirections for HTMLAnchorElement.
*  **router**: The router instance.
*  **src**: Markdown source.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A virtual DOM encapsulating the parsed Markdown.
